questions.question_text_1: General Instructions:  (i) All questions are compulsory.  (ii) For long-answer type questions, the word limit and marks for each question are mentioned alongside it. The answers can be short and to the point. So, think for 80% of the time and the remaining 20% for typing.  Refrain from looking at the neighbouring candidate's screen/elsewhere and reproducing their answers. Such behaviour is easily detectable and may attract penalties. Please be mindful that irrelevant answers, responding with unrelated content or duplicating information already provided in the question paper will not earn you marks. Focus on delivering accurate answers, drawing on your learning and personal or professional context.  (iii) For multiple choice questions, each question carries one mark.
question_texts: General Instructions:  (i) All questions are compulsory.  (ii) For long-answer type questions, the word limit and marks for each question are mentioned alongside it. questions.question_text_1: Explore the application of any four of Howard Gardner’s multiple intelligences in your personal development journey. (Answer in 100 words, 4 Marks)  Guidelines: Choose any 4 intelligences and elucidate how they contribute to your self-improvement, the development of human capital, and the enhancement of mental well-being.
question_texts: Explore the application of any four of Howard Gardner’s multiple intelligences in your personal development journey. (Answer in 100 words, 4 Marks)  Guidelines: Choose any 4 intelligences and elucidate how they contribute to your self-improvement, the development of human capital, and the enhancement of mental well-being.

questions.question_text_1: Read the fictionalized caselet given below and answer the question that follows:   Sankaran is a student in an online Undergraduate Degree program. He has been posting negative, unsubstantiated comments about the program and its courses on a social media platform. Sankaran was found mocking the curriculum, pedagogy, and content of certain courses. Furthermore, he inadvertently incited other learners to support his perspective on the platform.  A concerned fellow student, who wishes to remain anonymous, has brought this matter to the attention of the Student Affairs Coordinator (SAC). They now have enough proof to identify and track the person responsible for the posts on social platforms. The SAC has verified that the posts were indeed made by Sankaran and that it is harming the reputation of the program. Additionally, the SAC discovered that Sankaran has not utilized any of the grievance redressal mechanisms or feedback channels available to him for voicing his concerns or suggestions for improvement. Instead, he has chosen to defame and slander the program. It seems he is unaware of the program's non-academic misconduct policies, modelled after corporate social media guidelines, which appear to be ineffective or not well-enforced in addressing such issues.  As the program gears up for upcoming placements, timing is crucial. Many learners, including Sankaran, have applied for opportunities. It is a well-known fact that hiring managers increasingly scrutinize the online behaviour of applicants. Such posts have caused discomfort to his peers, who are potential employees for the numerous visiting companies.  Question: Discuss the ethical implications of such behaviour on the social platform. What action should SAC take to address this issue? (Answer in 100 words, 4 Marks)   Guidelines: You can support your answer based on your own professional experience or learnings from “Case Study: Should He Be Fired for That Facebook Post? by Mary Anne Watson and Gabrielle R. Lopiano.”
question_texts: Read the fictionalized caselet given below and answer the question that follows:   Sankaran is a student in an online Undergraduate Degree program. He has been posting negative, unsubstantiated comments about the program and its courses on a social media platform. Sankaran was found mocking the curriculum, pedagogy, and content of certain courses. Furthermore, he inadvertently incited other learners to support his perspective on the platform.  A concerned fellow student, who wishes to remain anonymous, has brought this matter to the attention of the Student Affairs Coordinator (SAC). They now have enough proof to identify and track the person responsible for the posts on social platforms. The SAC has verified that the posts were indeed made by Sankaran and that it is harming the reputation of the program. Additionally, the SAC discovered that Sankaran has not utilized any of the grievance redressal mechanisms or feedback channels available to him for voicing his concerns or suggestions for improvement. Instead, he has chosen to defame and slander the program. It seems he is unaware of the program's non-academic misconduct policies, modelled after corporate social media guidelines, which appear to be ineffective or not well-enforced in addressing such issues.  As the program gears up for upcoming placements, timing is crucial. Many learners, including Sankaran, have applied for opportunities. It is a well-known fact that hiring managers increasingly scrutinize the online behaviour of applicants. Such posts have caused discomfort to his peers, who are potential employees for the numerous visiting companies.  Question: Discuss the ethical implications of such behaviour on the social platform. What action should SAC take to address this issue? (Answer in 100 words, 4 Marks)   Guidelines: You can support your answer based on your own professional experience or learnings from “Case Study: Should He Be Fired for That Facebook Post? by Mary Anne Watson and Gabrielle R. Lopiano.”

questions.question_text_1: Examine the use of any three creativity tools in overcoming challenges. (Answer in 200 words, 6 Marks)  Guidelines: Select any three tools discussed in lectures or that you are familiar with, and provide insights into their practical applications within various problem-solving scenarios (in the workplace, business, education, research, etc.)
question_texts: Examine the use of any three creativity tools in overcoming challenges. questions.question_text_1: A. Describe a system with the example of heap vs system. (1 mark)  B. Explain the principle of systems thinking illustrated by the story of ‘The Blind Men And The Elephant.’ (2 marks)  C. Select a systems thinking “archetype” and elaborate with an example from your daily life for personal or professional growth.(3 marks)  (Answer A, B, and C combined in 200 words)  Guidelines: Provide a comprehensive response to questions A, B, and C within a total limit of 200 words. For C, select any one of the archetypes (not principle or habit) and elaborate on its application.
question_texts: A. Describe a system with the example of heap vs system. (1 mark)  B. Explain the principle of systems thinking illustrated by the story of ‘The Blind Men And The Elephant.’ (2 marks)  C. Select a systems thinking “archetype” and elaborate with an example from your daily life for personal or professional growth.(3 marks)  (Answer A, B, and C combined in 200 words)  Guidelines: Provide a comprehensive response to questions A, B, and C within a total limit of 200 words. For C, select any one of the archetypes (not principle or habit) and elaborate on its application.

questions.question_text_1: Consider the following constructs  1. Mood management 2. Managing relationships 3. Self-awareness  Which of the following belongs to emotional intelligence?
question_texts: Consider the following constructs  1. Mood management 2. Managing relationships 3. Self-awareness  Which of the following belongs to emotional intelligence?

questions.question_text_1: According to the 6R Framework in the Emotional Intelligence and Conflict Management module, the aspect of "Rationalize" involves:
question_texts: According to the 6R Framework in the Emotional Intelligence and Conflict Management module, the aspect of "Rationalize" involves:

options.option_text: Respecting the diversity of emotions within oneself and others
Ability to process emotions instead of suppressing them
Developing a rationale for every emotion experienced

questions.question_text_1: Consider the following regarding conflict in the workplace: 1. Conflict is a dysfunctional outcome resulting from poor communication, a lack of openness and trust between people, and the failure of managers to be responsive to the needs and aspirations of their employees. 2. Not all conflicts are good, but a minimal level of conflict can help keep a group viable, self-critical, and creative.  Which of the given statement(s) is/are correct:
question_texts: Consider the following regarding conflict in the workplace: 1. Conflict is a dysfunctional outcome resulting from poor communication, a lack of openness and trust between people, and the failure of managers to be responsive to the needs and aspirations of their employees. 2. Not all conflicts are good, but a minimal level of conflict can help keep a group viable, self-critical, and creative.  Which of the given statement(s) is/are correct:

questions.question_text_1: Akriti tends to handle conflicts by consistently refraining from taking a clear stance and often withdraws mentally or physically, escaping direct confrontation. What term best describes her approach to conflict resolution?
question_texts: Akriti tends to handle conflicts by consistently refraining from taking a clear stance and often withdraws mentally or physically, escaping direct confrontation. What term best describes her approach to conflict resolution?

questions.question_text_1: How is EQ distinct from other intelligences?
question_texts: How is EQ distinct from other intelligences?

options.option_text: It comprises a set of skills.
It can be easily measured using tests, unlike IQ.
The focus is on emotional reasoning, ability, and knowledge.
The emphasis is primarily on logical reasoning and cognitive skills.

questions.question_text_1: Consider the following statements  1. Home loan principal repayment is considered a tax-saving investment. 2. Life insurance premium is considered a tax-saving investment. 3. Public Provident is considered a tax-saving investment. 4. Fixed deposits are considered a tax-saving investment. How many of the statements given above are correct?

questions.question_text_1: In organizations, there is a noticeable increase in dishonest practices and deception among employees, presumably to gain an advantage in the talent race. questions.question_text_1: Organizational Culture: In a global software development company, two distinct team dynamics are observed:  Scenario 1: The Turkish management team insists that their approach is the only approach and tends to overlook suggestions from the American team.  Scenario 2: Conversely, the American team considers their methods to be the best methods and dismisses ideas originating from the Turkish team.  Based on the above data, answer the given subquestions.
question_texts: Organizational Culture: In a global software development company, two distinct team dynamics are observed:  Scenario 1: The Turkish management team insists that their approach is the only approach and tends to overlook suggestions from the American team.  Scenario 2: Conversely, the American team considers their methods to be the best methods and dismisses ideas originating from the Turkish team.  Based on the above data, answer the given subquestions.
